name: Query
description: Question consisting of one or more words.

name: Identify property to filter on
description: Skill of figuring out which property you can use to filter that will give you the target.  Example: should you filter by image type (color, face, photo, line art), filetype (ppt, pdf, csv...), date, site... etc.

name: Filter
description: Concept of flitering results sets by different properties.

name: Filter by color
description: Filter images by color.

name: Filter by similarity
description: Filter images by similarity.

name: Image search
description: Use image search when it appears in search results, and use related image search to refine results.

name: Spider
description: A program that crawls the web to create the index.

name: How search works
description: Learn how search works.

name: Salient word
description: Semantic word with high discrimination power.

name: Choose keywords
description: Learn to choose effective keywords.

name: Parasite word
description: Words creating noise; opposite of salient keywords.

name: Keyword choice
description: Impact of the choice of search keywords.

name: Query refinement
description: Iterative query refinement.

name: Effective query
description: Learn to build effective queries.

name: Caps
description: Caps do not matter.

name: find_text function
description: Finding text on a web page.

name: Type ahead suggestion
description: Display of common queries that others have typed.

name: Information summary
description: Information panel showing an information summary about a topic.

name: Search as you type
description: Show search result in the background while typing.

name: Explore concept
description: Explore the search space around a concept using information from knowledge graph panels, instant results, suggestions, and related searches.

name: define function
description: Define function or dictionary function

name: Deep understanding
description: Learn to use tools to go from a vague concept to a deeper understanding.

name: Kinds of media
description: Learn to use the different kinds of media.

name: Use various media results
description: Select various media results to improve quality. Learn how different media results complement each other.

name: Ellipses
description: The snippet has "ellipses" in it that shorten the snippet to a readable length.

name: Results structure
description: Block structure of search results, consisting of title, source url, summary-snippet, highlighted keywords, overview, top-level-domain, deep-links, secondary-search-box

name: SERP
description: Reading the search engine results page. Use the page preview tool. Parts of a search engine result.

name: Rollover
description: Use the rollover preview tool to understand better an issue.

name: Skimming through results
description: Process information quickly by skimming through the search results.

name: Research topic
description: Learn to research a topic iteratively.

name: Search 3D models
description: Search in 3D models.

name: Search legal docs
description: Search in legal content.

name: Search books
description: Search in books.

name: Find different kinds of content
description: Find different kinds of content efficiently: blogs, discussions, recipes, patents, books, 3D models, scholarly sources, and legal documents.

name: News search
description: What is News search?  And how to do it. (Use the News tab.)

name: Query order
description: Does the order of terms in a query matter?  Usually, no.  But once in a while, it makes a big difference.  How Google treats search terms in a query.

name: Query formatting
description: What you need to know to format your search query properly.  Includes "no space after the colon"  and "no space after the minus-sign"  and format your site name properly (e.g., include the periods)

name: Operator
description: Signals to do something special and returns a subset of the results.

name: Site operator
description: Focus on relevant results.

name: Combine operators
description: Combine operators to refine searches.

name: Use minus operator
description: Removing invasive results.

name: Quotes operator
description: Phrase search.

name: Intext operator
description: Use intext operator to ensure the word you want is on the page you find.

name: Adv. Search UI
description: Use the Advanced Search UI when appropriate.

name: Search by image
description: Identify an image with Search by Image.

name: Search help
description: Learn to get help on search.

name: Find facts
description: Find facts about movies, drugs, cities, world-times, ups-tracking, flights using shortcuts.

name: Do calculations
description: Perform calculations in the browser.

name: Easter egg
description: Fun response to a query. Google does something you don't expect, e.g., [ how many horns does a unicorn have? ]

name: Convert b/n units
description: Convert between various measurement units.

name: Graph equations
description: Graph a single or multiple functions.

name: Infographics
description: Display infographics in the browser.

name: Convert calculate visualize
description: Calculate math expressions and conversions from the search box.

name: Time range query
description: Limit results to sources from a specific time period.

name: Translate
description: Translate words, sentences, and pages.

name: Foreign language search
description: Search pages in foreign languages using English.

name: Understand credibility
description: "Credibility" means the degree to which you find a resource believable.  Usually, that means it's accurate and created by an authoritative author(s).

name: URL structure
description: A web address, or URL, is composed of several parts.  First is the "protocol" (e.g., HTTP). Second comes the website name (e.g., www.historysite.com), of which the last part is the "top level domain"  (the .com part).  Lastly  comes the filename (e.g., "imperialism/actions.html")  which points directly to the file on the target website.

name: Site perspective
description: Understand site perspective.

name: Verify site credibility
description: Verify the credibility of information you find. Distinguish between popularity and credibility.

name: Avoid confirmation bias
description: Avoid confirmation bias when conducting searches.

name: Compare results
description: How to compare results between different searches.  Useful for understanding variant viewpoints.

name: Do not bake answer in
description: That is, do NOT put the expected answer into your query -- that leads Google to search for those terms. It's similar to "leading the witness" instead of allowing them to come up with answer on their own.

name: Variant data
description: Explore different variations of a concept or piece of information.

name: Google Books
description: Google Books is a large collection of scanned, indexed texts.  There are millions of books in Google Books, all searchable (although they vary greatly in the degree to which you can read the text, as determined by publishers).

name: Use authoritative sources
description: Search appropriate sources that offer authoritative information for the type of information you are trying to find.

name: Whois
description: Use Whois to identify site owner.

name: Site meta info
description: Find site meta information.

name: Order of results
description: The order of results on the SERP is determined by many factors (hundreds!).  But it is important to know that the order in which results appear on the page are the search engine's best estimate about how useful that result is with-respect-to your query.   It's important to know that the order of results is determined ONLY by the algorithm, and that someone cannot pay Google to move their result up higher into the results sequence.

name: Vetting
description: In English "vetting" means to give approval to something.  Such as, "This book has been vetted to be complete and accurate."  In some cases, people misinterpret things they see as implicit "vetting."  For instance, many sites use the Google Custom Search logo to indicate that they're using the Google tools to support their search process.  But Google does NOT vet their content--the Google Custom Search logo simply indicates that the code they're using is from Google--not that Google approves or has checked the quality of the site's content.

name: Distinguish products
description: Distinguish between the Google products that indicate credibility and those that do not.

name: Know available tools
description: Searchers need to know what kinds of tools are possible to use in their search process.  Example: when doing geographically-based searches, it's useful to know that Streetview often contains imagery of non-street areas (e.g., that around Stonehenge).  Generally, searchers need to know what the range of tools is, and what they can do with them.

name: Or operator
description: Use OR to include more than one way of expressing an idea.

name: Streetview
description: Streetview is the ability to look around a location by using Google Maps.  Streetview also contains lots of non-street imagery as well (e.g., there are 'street views' inside of the US White House).

name: Google News
description: Google's aggregation of news feeds from around the world.

name: Context terms
description: Context terms are terms added to a query that help target the search to objects that have particular properties.  For instance, to understand how a planetary gear works, you might have to add the context term "diagram" to your image search to find diagrams that illustrate how such a gear works.
